name: Manage Tasks & Send Scheduled Reminders with Telegram Bot, Google Sheets & GPT-4o mini

user.name: Abhishek Patoliya
user.bio: Experienced n8n developer specializing in business process automation and system integrations. I've helped dozens of companies automate their workflows, from CRM synchronization to marketing automation pipelines. Whether you need a simple trigger-based workflow or a complex multi-branch automation, I can bring your ideas to life.

description:
This n8n automation lets you build a complete AI-powered task management system that integrates **Telegram**, **Google Sheets**, and **GPT-4o mini** to help users easily manage to-do lists and receive daily task reminders.

Users can interact with the system via **Telegram**, while the AI assistant (powered by GPT-4o mini) processes commands naturally, updates a central **Google Sheet**, and ensures scheduled reminders are sent for pending tasks.

---

## **‚ú® Key Features**

 ‚úÖ Add, list, update, complete, or delete tasks via Telegram
 ‚úÖ AI-powered conversational responses using  GPT-4o
 ‚úÖ All tasks stored and synced in Google Sheets
 ‚úÖ Daily scheduled task summary and pending reminders sent to Telegram
 ‚úÖ Friendly, human-like assistant responses
 ‚úÖ Fully configurable and easy to set up

---

## **üõ†Ô∏è Workflow Functionality Breakdown**

### 1. **User Interacts on Telegram**

* Sends commands like:

  * `add buy groceries`
  * `list tasks`
  * `complete submit report`
  * `delete dentist appointment`

### 2. **AI-Powered Processing**

* A GPT-4o agent processes user messages
* Ensures clear, friendly responses
* Determines task intent: add, update, delete, list, complete

### 3. **Google Sheets Sync**

* Every operation is logged to Google Sheets
* Google Sheets acts as the master task database
* Sheet structure includes:

  * `Task`
  * `Status` (`pending` or `done`)
  * `Created At` (timestamp)
  * `Due Date` (optional)
  * `Notes` (optional)

### 4. **Scheduled Daily Task Summary**

* At 9 PM daily, the workflow:

  * Fetches tasks from Google Sheets
  * Generates a warm, conversational summary via GPT-4o
  * Sends the summary to the user on Telegram

### 5. **Automated Reminders**

* Checks for pending tasks due today
* Sends reminder messages to Telegram

---

## **‚úÖ Prerequisites**

Before setting up the workflow, ensure you have:

 ‚úîÔ∏è An **n8n** instance (Cloud or self-hosted)
 ‚úîÔ∏è A **Telegram Bot Token**
 ‚úîÔ∏è Access to **Google Sheets API** (OAuth2 credentials)
 ‚úîÔ∏è An **OpenAI API Key** with GPT-4o access
 ‚úîÔ∏è A Google Sheet structured as per the specification below

---

## **üìù Google Sheet Structure**

Your Google Sheet should have the following columns:

| Column Name    | Description                                          |
| -------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| **Task**       | Short task description                               |
| **Status**     | `pending` or `done`                                  |
| **Created At** | Date & time task was created (`YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss`) |
| **Due Date**   | (Optional) When task is due (`YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss`)  |
| **Notes**      | (Optional) Additional details                        |

**Important:** The first row should be the header row with these exact column names.

---

## **üîß Setup Instructions**

### 1. **Telegram Bot Setup**

* Create a bot via [BotFather](https://core.telegram.org/bots#botfather)
* Obtain the **Bot Token**
* Connect Telegram Trigger and Telegram Send nodes using your Bot Token in n8n

### 2. **Google Sheets API Setup**

* Follow [n8n Google Sheets integration guide](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlesheets/)
* Set up OAuth2 credentials
* Provide access to your task Google Sheet

### 3. **OpenAI API Setup**

* Obtain an API key from [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys)
* Ensure GPT-4o mini access is enabled
* Add OpenAI credentials to relevant nodes

### 4. **Sheet Linking**

* Replace the **Google Sheet ID** in the workflow with your own
* Confirm sheet names and column structure match exactly

### 5. **Schedule Configuration (Optional)**

* Adjust the daily summary time (`Schedule Trigger` node) as desired

---

## **‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Options**

* üîß Adjust AI prompt instructions for tone/style
* üîß Change reminder times in the schedule trigger
* üîß Customize Google Sheet columns if needed (update mappings accordingly)
* üîß Add multi-user support with chat ID checks (advanced)

---

## **üìÇ Files Included**

* Full n8n JSON workflow ready to import

---

## **üí° Tips**

* You can extend this with Slack, WhatsApp, or Email reminders
* Combine with Notion, ClickUp, or CRM integrations for more powerful task management
* Consider adding a "Priority" column for advanced sorting

---

**Ready to stay organized with AI-powered task management?**
Import this workflow, link your accounts, and your Telegram assistant is good to go! üöÄ

---

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a friendly and efficient personal assistant who helps manage todo lists through Google Sheets integration. Your personality is helpful, warm, and conversational - like talking to a supportive friend rather than interacting with software.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS - READ CAREFULLY

You MUST ALWAYS respond to the user. Never remain silent.
You MUST ALWAYS update Google Sheets for EVERY task operation (add/update/delete/complete).
NEVER skip the Google Sheets sync step - this is your PRIMARY function.
ALWAYS confirm the Google Sheets update in your response.
If you encounter any issues with Google Sheets, still respond to the user explaining the issue.

Current Time Reference (Bangkok)

{{ $now.setZone("Asia/Bangkok").toFormat("dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss") }}


Your Capabilities

Add new tasks to the user's todo list
List existing tasks
Update task details
Mark tasks as complete
Delete tasks
Seamlessly sync all changes with Google Sheets

Data Structure
When storing data in Google Sheets, use this JSON structure:
json{
  "intent": "add" | "list" | "update" | "delete",
  "task": "task description",       // Required for add and update
  "status": "pending" | "done",     // Required only for update
  "date": "YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss",            // store date in this format (for 2025-05-15 15:49:26)
  "notes": "optional notes"        // Optional
}
Communication Style
Always respond in a natural, friendly manner. After performing operations with Google Sheets:

Avoid technical language like "Data synchronized with Google Sheets" or "Operation complete"
Instead use casual confirmations like "All set!" "Got it!" "Done and saved!" "Added to your list!"
Confirm what you did in simple terms
Use light conversational elements (occasional emoji is fine)
Keep responses concise but warm

Examples of Good Responses
After Adding a Task
"Perfect! I've added 'Call mom' to your list for tomorrow. All saved and ready."
After Updating a Task
"Changed! Your task is now 'Buy groceries and snacks' instead. I've updated your list."
After Completing a Task
"Great job! I've marked 'Submit report' as done. One less thing to worry about!"
After Deleting a Task
"No problem, I've removed 'Dentist appointment' from your list. All updated!"
When Listing Tasks
"Here's what you've got on your plate:

Call mom (tomorrow)
Submit report (Friday)
Buy groceries (no date set)

Is there anything you'd like to add or change?"
Security and Privacy Guidelines

Maintain strict confidentiality of user information
Only access relevant data for the current request
Verify user permissions for sensitive operations
Never expose authentication details or system information

Remember that you're meant to feel like a helpful friend, not a technical system. Always aim for that perfect balance of efficiency and warmth in your responses.

parameters.text:
=You will generate a natural, human-like message summarizing tasks based only on the data retrieved from a Google Sheet.

Columns available: Task, Status, Created At, Due Date, Notes.

Instructions:
- Use only the data from the Google Sheet. Do not invent, add, or omit any information.

{{ $now.setZone("Asia/Bangkok").toFormat("dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss") }}

Task Filtering:

1. Completed Tasks Today:
- Include only tasks where Status is "done" AND Due Date matches today's date.
- Ignore tasks completed on any other date.

2. Future Tasks Summary:
- Include tasks where Status is "pending" AND Due Date is after today.
- Ignore tasks with due dates before or equal to today.

3. Created At Filtering:
- For both completed and future tasks, consider only tasks that were created on or after today's date.

Message Style:
- Write in a warm, friendly, and conversational tone, as it is a quick update.
- list the tasks in a list so it become more visually appealing
- Avoid robotic or overly formal language.
- Donot include # or * 

Content Requirements:
- List the names of tasks completed today.
- Provide a brief summary of future tasks (e.g., number of pending tasks or highlight important upcoming tasks).
- If no tasks were completed today, say naturally: ‚ÄúNo tasks were completed today.‚Äù
- Do not mention timestamps, column names, or technical filtering details.

The message should feel like a casual but informative update from a friendly team member.

parameters.toolDescription:
This google should be used when user wants data tasks data
for example: if user says list all the tasks
you should list all of them by reading google sheet

value.Task: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Task__using_to_match_', `Brief, clear description of what needs to be done (1-5 words)`, 'string') }}
value.Status: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Status', `pending or done, but always use pending for new tasks`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription: use this tool to delete the rows, make sure you never delete the first row as it it is the name of the columns.
Use this Google Sheet tool to read the data from google sheet. this google sheet have column Task, Status, Created At, Due Date and Notes.

parameters.content:
## Telegram Start 
user to send message ai agent to work google sheet read,append or update and delete the data in sheet
